latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations. (text of measure as introduced: CR S3078-3079)

item.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate on the policy of the United States regarding stabilizing the currency of Ukraine.
A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate on the policy of the United States regarding stabilizing the currency of Ukraine.

bill.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate on the policy of the United States regarding stabilizing the currency of Ukraine.

item.text: Expresses the sense of the Senate that: (1) the United States and Ukraine should examine the benefits of implementing a currency board system as a way to stabilize Ukraine's currency and improve its economy, and (2) the Secretary of the Treasury should work with the International Monetary Fund (IMF) to create such a currency board if Ukraine decides to implement one.
item.name: Introduced in Senate

item.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations. (text of measure as introduced: CR S3078-3079)

item.name: International monetary system and foreign exchange

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
